group_1.textLeft: Good question, Hagurinâ˜…
To tell you the truth...
If I hadn't sensed Miwarin's magic power at@the station on the first day...
We would've never figured it out, either.

group_1.textRight: Magic power...?

group_1.textLeft: Yup, that's how I was able to track down the@criminals from the incidents.

group_1.textRight: ...I wasn't transformed at the station, so how@could I have left traces of magic...?

group_1.textLeft: Didn't you feel it, Kazarin?

group_1.textRight: ...I can't deny that.
But, since she's a Magical Girl, it's just normal@for her to give off magic.

group_1.textLeft: The reaction felt too strong for that kind of thing.

group_1.textRight: ...I had nothing to do with this.

group_1.textLeft: But, you see, your magic lingers in front of@the station every day.
And the people who committed crimes all passed@through there in their day-to-day lives.

group_1.textRight: I was trying to help the people of Takarazaki...
...for myself, but still, I didn't do anything bad...

group_1.textLeft: Princess... That has to be wrong...@It couldn't be Mitsune...
She's trying even harder to change than we are...

group_1.textRight: Shigure...

group_1.textLeft: Don't worry, Shigurin. I'm not trying to blame her.
As long as this problem is settled, it's all good.

group_1.textRight: However, it's a bit of a stretch to claim that she's@the culprit simply because you sensed her magic.
Right, right, I think Lady San is right!
Do you have any conclusive evidence,@Your Highness?

group_1.textLeft: Miwarin's ability is "falsification of perception",@isn't it?

group_1.textRight: ...I never used it in front of the station.

group_1.textLeft: You mentioned something about a daily routine.@What were you doing...?

group_1.textRight: ...As part of my efforts to help the people@of Takarazaki during these difficult times...
I tried to put their minds at ease...

group_1.narration: So, everyone needs to watch out...
You may get too nervous,@and cause another accident.
You may have reflected on your actions,@but ended up stealing something anyway.
You may lose your temper,@and start a fight at any moment.
If something bad happens, we'll solve it, so don't worry.@But right now, in this town,@you never know who might turn out to be a criminal.

group_1.textLeft: Even if you didn't intend to, isn't it possible you@used it unconsciously?
But, that doesn't add up...
Wasn't the strange situation at Takarazaki@the reason why they came...?
They wanted to solve it for publicity, right...?

group_1.textRight: If that's the case, then Himena's reasoning@wouldn't make sense...
No, we were going to Takarazaki before that...

group_1.textLeft: Was that to conceal Miwa's actions...?

group_1.textRight: Of course not.

group_1.textLeft: Then, the reason for that was...

group_1.textRight: Just a coincidence...
We stayed away from Kamihama because people@would recognize us there.
That's the original reason we started going to@Takarazaki.

group_1.textLeft: That means there's no discrepancy in the timeline,@and it coincides with the start of the account.
Plus, I'm pretty sure that's when the number of@Takarazaki's cases started to rise.

group_1.textRight: So you lied to us because you wanted to be@sure of that...?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, my bae told me to try it.
We thought that if she got anxious,@crime would spike.

group_1.textRight: If she were anxious...?

group_1.textLeft: For Miwarin, Takarazaki was a place where she@could make a name for herself.
It was a precious place where she could change@herself and stop being a person she hated.
But then there weren't any problems to solve.
Her number of followers weren't increasing@and her posts didn't draw any attention.
She ran out of material to work with.
Plus, even if she dealt with a Witch, there'd be@no proof she did anything.
If she tells someone she beat a Witch, it'd just@look like she's taking 'em for a ride.
If she wasn't able to prove it, people would just@bash her account.
That's why we thought the mess would@get worse.

group_1.textRight: Was it...really me...?

group_1.textLeft: As a result, her routine became more elaborate@than usual.
Aren't there more incidents and accidents now?

group_1.textRight: If your hypothesis is correct...that would indeed@explain the increase...
